definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
(fig.) to have a meeting with state security agents (to be warned to behave "responsibly")
to eat and drink/food and drink
to shout/to bawl/to yell (to urge on an animal)/to hawk (one's wares)/to denounce loudly/to shout slogans
to eat, drink and be merry (idiom)/to abandon oneself to a life of pleasure
to eat and drink as much as one likes/to make a pig of oneself
to shout an order or command
(of yamen bailiffs etc) to walk ahead of an official, shouting at pedestrians to clear the way
to shout at sb to stop
to boo or jeer (as a sign of displeasure at an actor)
to eat, drink, shit, piss, and sleep/(fig.) the ordinary daily routine
to go dining, wining, whoring and gambling/to lead a life of dissipation

sentences.english: Yeah, but scented tea is now in fashion.
sentences.chinese: 是的，但现在的时尚是喝花茶。

sentences.english: Hard to drink, and drink around a long time that nothing effects.
sentences.chinese: 好难喝的，周围长时间喝的说没啥效果。

sentences.english: Rather the sun once connects the agreeable son carries of tea ugg tall drinks, superficial drank one one morsel.
sentences.chinese: 宁阳接过良儿端来的茶水，浅浅喝了一口。

sentences.english: We also use instant tea and coffee.
sentences.chinese: 他们也喜欢喝马上冲马上喝的茶和咖啡。

sentences.english: We also use instant tea and coffee.
sentences.chinese: 他们也喜欢喝马上冲马上喝的茶和咖啡。

sentences.english: We could go get a bowl of fish balls and wash it down with a sour plum drink.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以去喝一碗鱼丸汤，然后用酸梅汁将它消化掉。

sentences.english: He drank a tumbler of brandy.
It says I'll have lots to eat and drink today.
sentences.chinese: 报上说今天我会有许多吃的喝的。

sentences.english: Santiago drank sparingly from his water bottle during the hot afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 在炽热的下午，桑提亚哥节省地喝起水壶里的水。

sentences.english: cold waters to a thirsty soul, so [is] good news from a far country.
sentences.chinese: 有好消息从远方来，就如拿凉水给口渴的人喝。

sentences.english: Baby giant pandas spend a lot of time drinking their mum's milk.
sentences.chinese: 小熊猫花费大量的时间喝他们妈妈的奶水。

sentences.english: He took a big gulp and almost chocked.
Try to drink plenty of water or electrolyte fluids to get rid of stomach virus.
sentences.chinese: 为了消除肠胃感染病毒，要喝大量的水或电解质液体。

sentences.english: Drinking potato juice every day can ease indigestion, a new study has found.
sentences.chinese: 一项新的调查，每天喝土豆汁可以消化不良的症状。

sentences.english: At Oktoberfest, many people drink too much beer and then pass out.
sentences.chinese: 在啤酒节时，许多人会因喝太多啤酒而昏睡不醒。

sentences.english: And a cola he quaffed named Fenhuang fizzled.
sentences.chinese: 一种他大口大口喝的可乐被称为“风花告吹”。

definition: to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
